results.title: My man Godfrey
results.creator_credit: Gregory La Cava and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is one of the classic screwball comedies of its time. An heiress (Carole Lombard), hires a butler (William Powell) after finding him on a scavenger hunt. She and her family are under the impression that he is a tramp without a job. He decides to teach “High Society” that money isn’t everything, and in the tradition of screwball comedy gets his girl as well as making his point. The film was unsuccessful at the Academy Awards despite six nominations but remains one of the best of its genre. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Electric Shadow Productions, ACT III Communications and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife, Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports her back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to seperate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.

results.title: Nikita
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Jerome Chalou, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Nikita (Anne Parillaud) is a junkie psychopath who gets life imprisonment for shooting a cop while she’s high on drugs. Whilst in prison she is given a second chance at life when she is asked to become an undercover agent for the French secret service. Within three years, after gruelling training, Nikita emerges as a superspy, a highly trained assassin, who kills effectively and emotionlessly until she falls in love … and then her world begins to crumble. Filmed with an adrenelin speed by Besson and shot in elegant colour by Thierry Arbogats, “Nikita” is a stylish thriller that breathed new life into the spy genre by its audacious use of style and art direction. From its tense beginning to the rivetting climax, “Nikita” is a non-stop rollercoaster.

results.title: The Sundowners
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Sundowners stars Deborah Kerr and Robert Mitchum as Paddy and Ida Carmody, migrant drovers who travel 400 miles of Australian outback with 1200 sheep. Despite their devotion to each other and their acceptance of the itinerant life, Ida and their son Sean yearn to settle down on a farm of their own. The Carmody’s own drama is played out against the backdrop of Australia’s startling landscapes; at one moment lush and green and in the next, stark and forbidding. This film is a a testamony to the keen eye of director Fred Zinnemann and the excellent performances of Robert Mitchum and Deborah Kerr. Based on the novel by Jon Cleary.

results.title: Priest
results.creator_credit: Antonia Bird, George Faber, Josephine Ward, BBC, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Electric Pictures (Aust)
results.brief_description: A young priest tests his faith and vocation when assigned to a working class Parish in Liverpool. When a teenage girl confesses of her father’s incestuous advances, he is torn by the rituals of a Church which swears him to silence and to which he owes obedience, and his innate sense of justice. This conflict is compounded by his struggle with his own desires and sexuality as he enters into an illicit homosexual relationship. Linus Roache is excellent and well supported by a cast including Tom Wilkinson, Cathy Tyson and Robert Carlyle. “Priest” does not seek to attack organised religion; instead it offers a window into the heart and mind of a believer who struggles daily with his faith and vocation to find a true path.

results.title: Pocahontas
results.creator_credit: Eric Goldberg, Mike Gabriel, James Pentecost and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: The legendary tale of the meeting of Pocahontas, American Indian Princess, and Captain John Smith is vividly recreated with the Disney recipe for success; two cheeky animal companions, the racoon Meeko and hummingbird Flit, vibrant colours and captivating music. A film for the family to enjoy as Pocahontas learns to listen to her heart. Features the Academy Award winning score of Alan Menken and Stephen Schwartz. Featuring the voices of Mel Gibson, Irene Bedard, Judy Kuhn, David Ogden Stiers, Linda Hunt, Christian Bale, John Kassir, Billy Connolly.

results.title: Pride and prejudice (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Five marriageable daughters! What’s a mother to do? What’s a father to do? What are we to do? Laugh, cry and become totally entranced by “Pride and Prejudice”, Jane Austen’s classic comedy of manners. Adapted for the screen by Aldous Huxley, this energetic film Stars Greer Garson and Laurence Olivier. Also starring are Edmund Gwenn, Mary Boland, Maureen O’Sullivan and Ann Rutherford. The beautiful costumes are by renown designer Adrian.

results.title: Guys and dolls
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Damon Runyan about a pair of ne’er to do gamblers trying to snare a jackpot amidst the clutter of Times Square as well as the affections of two women. The excellent score by Frank Loesser includes “Luck be a lady”, “If I were a bell” and Stubby Kaye’s show stopper “Sitdown, you’re rocking the boat.” Choreographer Michale Kidd brought the dances full of flash and vitality to the screen. Starring Marlon Brando, Frank Sinatra, Jean Simmons and Vivian Blaine.

results.title: The Nutty professor
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lewis, Ernest D Glucksman and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Professor Julius F. Kelp (Jerry Lewis), is a chemistry teacher in a large university. Tired of being pushed around and humiliated, he dedicates himself to finding a scientific solution to his problem and discovers a chemical formula that transforms him from a clumsy, shy weakling into an irresistable, dynamic individual, called Buddy Love. However the potion often wears off at inappropriate times with embarrassing and hilarious results. Julius finds himself juggling a hectic doublelife, meek chemistry professor by day, local celebrity and heart throb by night. Inevitably these two worlds collide. Written and directed by Jerry Lewis, this madcap comedy is a swinging combination of farce, slapstick and romance.

results.title: Saraband for dead lovers
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Film Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
George the Ist of England came from the small independent German state of Hanover and when he succeeded to the throne of England, he left behind a prisoner in the Castle of Ahlden, Princess Sophia Dorothea, his wife. She married George Louis against her will and this is a tragic tale full of melodrama, intrigue and spectacle. The costumes and settings alike will delight. Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay, Flora Robson, Anthony Quayle and Michael Gough star in this period drama based on a novel by Helen Simpson.
